inventory.commentary: Distinction between senses 1 and 5 based on FrameNet framesets for Body_Movement and Closure

sense.name: cause or become accessible state, make or become available
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] OPEN NP2[patient] NP1[theme] OPEN Note: compare carefully to sense 5; this sense refers to a 'container' being made accessible by opening a portal (ie: "open the box" or "open the lid" or "open the lid to the box") In sense 5, there is no distinction between portal and container. Includes: OPEN UP
sense.examples: She opened the hood to check the oil. The door won't open. This decision will open him to attacks from the press. That memory opened old wounds. She opened her heart to me. I tried talking to her about it and she opened up to me slowly. I can't seem to open any of these Ascii files. After you open your browser, select the preferences tab. They are opening that land for commercial use. A position in the neurology department has just opened. This opens up new possibilities! The Episcopal Church recently opened up the priesthood to women.

sense.name: initiate, begin an activity or operation
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 OPEN[punctual] (up) NP2[patient] (PP{with NP[instrument]}) Includes: OPEN UP
sense.examples: He opens every lecture with a joke. Stocks opened lower this morning. In that chess game, white opened with the queen's knight. They opened a new library downtown. You need a license to open up a liquor store. That store doesn't open for business on Sundays. Voting has opened for the blogging scholarship. Jackson Browne and Linda Ronstadt opened for The Eagles. Breckenridge Resort's Peak 8 base area opened for the season this week.

sense.name: lead to
sense.examples: The forest suddenly opened into a field of wild flowers. The master bedroom opens to a large terrace.

sense.name: unfold or extend something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] OPEN NP2[patient[concrete]] Note: compare carefully to sense 1; in this sense, there is no distinction between portal and container (ie, you cannot rephrase example 2 as, "She opened her body for a hug.") Includes: OPEN UP
sense.examples: The eagle opened his mighty wings. She opened her arms for a hug. He held it underhand and opened up his fingers.

sense.name: shoot at
sense.examples: The troops opened fire on innocent civilians. The squad opened fire on the prisoner.
